channel.title: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!
channel.description:
So what if Runescape added something where you people can sign armour or items, and then you could trade them so when you examine it or what not it would say signed by Zezima or whoever themselves!
Maybe only 1 signature can be on the item at a time, you can remove the signature or sign it yourself.
If some noob who sold this item to you decided to sign it themselves you can just remove it, but now if you have a famous pker, legend, top player, or a player you look up to sign it, then I think that's where it would be cool.
When your trading in the trade you would also be able to see who its signed by before you purchase it of course.
If I had a Dark bow signed by Lord Makup I think I would like it.
I think its a pretty cool idea..

item.title: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

Wouldn’t someone just remove Zezima’s signature if they’re allowed to remove sigs?

Zezima isn’t that great. His girlfriend can confirm this. Her R.S.N: “Barbiedoll”.

Read full topic

If some noob who sold this item to you decided to sign it themselves you can just remove it, but now if you have a famous pker, legend, top player, or a player you look up to sign it, then I think that’s where it would be cool.

item.source: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!

item.title: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:12, topic:514859”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=633109.msg4278856#msg4278856 date=1365273205]
It’s like the shitty WoW thing that says “Item Made By”, why can’t we have that too while we’re at it?
[/quote]Why is that shitty? You’d know who was producing all of items, which could maybe link to gold farmers/heavy botters?[/quote]Uhh… how could that link to it at all? Legit players can make plenty of materials to sell as well, and I doubt any one person would buy enough to possibly try and find anything suspicious. Even then, if Jagex wanted to keep track of that, they could easily without adding some pointless text on an item. It just takes us screen space, and doesn’t provide anything useful to the player. I guess I’m just trying to figure out the use of this at all. If I buy an item, I don’t want it to be signed.

For those that have read the Harry Potter books, it’s like the goblin way of doing business. It’s the way of thinking that because you had the item at one point or made it you deserve to have your name all over it like it’s somehow still linked to you. Well you don’t, someone bought it and it’s theirs now.

However, what I think OP meant was not signing an item yourself that you made/got dropped, but getting someone famous to sign it so you can ‘prove you saw them’. While I think that’s extremely pointless and fanboyish, the easiest way to do this would be to create a new vanity item (“signature sheet”) or something so you can show people who you have met, instead of defacing actual useful items.

Read full topic

item.source: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!

item.title: Armour or Item signing? Would be cool!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I think everyone is hating just to hate. I don’t see it as such a bad idea. If I were playing and got a rare drop, I would definitely sign it. Maybe in the future I could find who owned it. It would be really cool to be honest, even just to see how much it circulated.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:514859”]That would be retarded.

Literally one of the worst ideas I have ever heard. No joke. Like if I had to pick between this and the EoC, I would probably stab myself in the eye with a fork and then eat it for breakfast deep fried in breadcrumbs rather than have to live with either of those pieces of garbage.

Yeah.[/quote]Someone hasn’t been outside in a while.

Read full topic
